Safe inits for the Kronecker model

Source: R/inits_kron.R
inits_kron.Rd

inits_kron() wraps a base initializer (if provided) and makes sure that legacy pieces (prec.par) and Kronecker precision terms (TauB, TauP) are not preset. This avoids conflicts when running the multi-biomarker Kronecker model.

Usage

inits_kron(chain, base_inits = NULL)

Arguments

chain

Integer chain index passed through to the base inits function.

base_inits

A function with signature function(chain) that returns a named list of initial values. Defaults to a simple RNG seed initializer.

Value

A base::list() of inits suitable for runjags.

Author

Kwan Ho Lee

Examples

# Basic usage with default RNG initializer
inits_kron(1)
#> $.RNG.name
#> [1] "base::Mersenne-Twister"
#> 
#> $.RNG.seed
#> [1] 124
#> 

# Using a custom base initializer
custom_inits <- function(chain) {
  list(.RNG.name = "base::Wichmann-Hill",
       .RNG.seed = 100 + chain,
       extra = "foo")
}
inits_kron(2, base_inits = custom_inits)
#> $.RNG.name
#> [1] "base::Wichmann-Hill"
#> 
#> $.RNG.seed
#> [1] 102
#> 
#> $extra
#> [1] "foo"
#>
